ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: We had a live online seminar discussion class. Some of the classes were asynchronous independent movie screenings. In class, we often watched videos or had some other form of visuals.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Conversational Italian skills, and knowledge about the language, culture, and history of Naples.
I learned much about the history and culture of Naples while building my knowledge of Italian through in-class conversations and assignments.
I learned a lot about the history and current culture of Naples, as well as some Italian history along with that. I really loved the emphasis on the linguistic history of Napoletano.

Through this course, I developed a strong understanding of the major historical events and cultural figures of Neapolitan history. This was facilitated through Professor Iacovella's highly interactive mode of teaching which included in-depth discussions with my peers, guest lecturers, and even online visits to the Yale University Art Gallery. The course helped me to improve my language and speaking skills in Italian while gaining a new understanding of an important city.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course was excellent, wish it couldve been in person but Anna did a great job of running it over zoom.

I would say the professor, Anna, is a strength of the course. She grew up in Napoli and clearly loves the city, and loves to teach about it. She knows everything about Napoli, and manages to keep the class interesting and lively.

The principal strength of this course was the Professor's unique and vast knowledge of the subject matter. This was complemented by a very well organized syllabus with engaging readings, films, and assignments.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Professor Iacovella did an amazing job of accommodating to the pandemic. I felt engaged in her class, and was very appreciative of the guest speakers she brought in. It felt as balanced as possible, and her coffee presentation was a lot of fun.
The class worked as well under the circumstances as it couldve.

I think that the practices geared toward virtual engagement were successful - zoom classes worked well, as did breakout rooms, and the asynchronous movie screenings were a nice break from the usual routine.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: If you want to practice a medium-high level of conversational Italian, while learning about Italian culture, the class is perfect. It's a small group, and everyone is able to meet everyone else. Great way to meet Italian speakers, and improve/maintain Italian language skills.
Yes, if you enjoy learning the Italian language and about the culture you will love this class.

Yes, I would recommend the course. This course was a lot of fun and had a pretty light workload, yet still had enough work to improve my Italian. I really liked my classmates and Anna, which improved the experience a lot.
I would definitely recommend this course to other Yale students. It is well organized and engaging. Professor Iacovella offers a truly unique and rich perspective on Naples' history and culture.

extras.title:
ITAL 159 01
        History and Culture of Naples
